title: How to Uninstall Epic Games Launcher: Full Guide With Fixes

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. Click the Start menu and type in "control panel". Click the Control Panel . [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Use this method to uninstall the Epic Games Launcher using Windows 11 or Windows 10 . Similar to Steam , Epic Games is a digital game launcher where you can purchase and play games. Uninstalling the launcher will remove any games you downloaded through it.

steps.title: Click Uninstall a program.
steps.content: Click Uninstall a program . This will be underneath the Programs header.

steps.title: Click Epic Games Launcher.
steps.content: Click Epic Games Launcher . If the list of applications isn't in alphabetical order, click the Name header to organize it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Uninstall.
steps.content: Click Uninstall . This will be above the list, next to Organize . You might see "Uninstall/Change". [3] X Research source A pop-up window will open. You can also right-click Epic Games Launcher and click Uninstall .

steps.title: Click Yes.
steps.content: Click Yes . Epic Games Launcher will begin uninstalling. If you're getting an error code, or if the Epic Games Launcher is still on your computer, see the #Troubleshooting section.

steps.title: Open the Finder.
steps.content: Open the Finder. This looks like a blue and grey face icon. You can find this on the Dock. [4] X Research source Uninstalling the launcher will remove any games you downloaded through it.

steps.title: Click Applications.
steps.content: Click Applications . This will be on the left panel, underneath AirDrop . [5] X Research source You'll see a list of all your applications.

steps.title: Right-click Epic Games Launcher.
steps.content: Right-click Epic Games Launcher . The applications will be organized in alphabetical order, so you may have to scroll down a little to find it. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Click Move to Trash/Bin.
steps.content: Click Move to Trash/Bin . You can also drag the Epic Games Launcher icon into the trash can on the Dock. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Empty the Trash/Bin.
steps.content: Empty the Trash/Bin. Click and hold the trash can icon in the Dock, then click Empty Trash/Bin . If you want to delete Epic Games Launcher without emptying your entire trash, click the trash icon. Control-click the Epic Games Launcher → Delete Immediately → Delete . [7] X Research source Epic Games Launcher will be deleted. Your Epic Games account will still be active, so you can reinstall the launcher and your games at any time. If you're getting an error code, or if the Epic Games Launcher is still on your computer, see the #Troubleshooting section.

steps.title: Make sure the launcher isn't running in the background.
steps.content: Make sure the launcher isn't running in the background. If you get the error: "Epic Games Launcher is currently running. Please close it before continuing," or if you're getting blocked from uninstalling, follow these steps: Windows : Right-click the Start menu and click Task Manager . Click Epic Games Launcher . Click End task . Try uninstalling again. Mac: Open the Activity Monitor app. [8] X Research source Click Epic Games Launcher . Click the stop button (X) in the top-left corner. Click Force Quit . Try uninstalling again.

steps.title: Delete leftover files (Windows).
steps.content: Delete leftover files (Windows). You may have temp files still on your device, and it may make it appear like the Launcher is still fully installed. Do the following: Delete the Epic Games folder: Open the File Explorer . Navigate to the Epic Games folder. On most devices, this is C:\Program Files\EpicGames . Right-click the Epic Games Folder. Click Delete . Delete the temp files: Open the Start menu and type %localappdata% . Click the %localappdata% folder. Right-click the Epic Games Launcher folder and click Delete . Click the Start menu and type %temp% . Click the %temp% folder. Select all files, right-click, and click Delete . Press Win + R to open the Run menu. Type prefetch and press Enter . Select all files, and press the Del/Delete key. Restart your computer.

steps.title: Delete leftover files (Mac).
steps.content: Delete leftover files (Mac). While putting an application in the trash uninstalls it, you may have leftover files on your device. Check the following locations on your Mac, and if you see unneeded folders, drag them to the trash bin to delete them. Check the following locations for Epic Games folders or files: /Home/Library/Applications Support/ /Library/StartupItems/ or /Home/Library/StartupItems/ /Library/LaunchAgents/ /Library/LaunchDaemons/ or /Home/Library/LaunchAgents/ /Library/Receipts/ If you see any Epic-related folders, drag them to the bin. Empty the bin.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer. If you still can't uninstall the Epic Games Launcher after the previous tips, try restarting your device fully to apply any changes. Then, try uninstalling again.
